content:
DesignerOptionService.DesignerOptionCollection Class

Definition

Contains a collection of designer options. This class cannot be inherited.

In this Article

[System.ComponentModel.Editor("", "System.Drawing.Design.UITypeEditor, System.Drawing, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b03f5f7f11d50a3a")]
[System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter(typeof(System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerOptionService/DesignerOptionConverter))]
public sealed class DesignerOptionService.DesignerOptionCollection : System.Collections.IList
Inheritance
System.Object
DesignerOptionService.DesignerOptionCollection

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
Equals(Object,Object)
GetHashCode()
GetType()
MemberwiseClone()
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
ToString()

Remarks

The DesignerOptionService.DesignerOptionCollection class is a collection that contains other DesignerOptionService.DesignerOptionCollection objects. This forms a tree of options, with each branch of the tree having a name and a possible collection of properties. Each parent branch of the tree contains a union of the properties of all the child branches.

Properties

Count

Gets the number of child option collections this DesignerOptionService.DesignerOptionCollection contains.

public int Count { get; }
Value
Int32

The number of child option collections this DesignerOptionService.DesignerOptionCollection contains.

Item(Int32)

Gets the child collection at the given index.

public System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerOptionService.DesignerOptionCollection this[int index] { get; }
index
Int32

The zero-based index of the child collection to get.

Value

The child collection at the specified index.

Item(String)

Gets the child collection at the given name.

public System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerOptionService.DesignerOptionCollection this[string name] { get; }
name
String

The name of the child collection.

Value

The child collection with the name specified by the name parameter, or null if the name is not found.

Remarks

The name search is case-insensitive.

Name

Gets the name of this DesignerOptionService.DesignerOptionCollection.

public string Name { get; }
Value
String

The name of this DesignerOptionService.DesignerOptionCollection.

Remarks

Names are programmatic names and are not localized. A name search is case-insensitive.

Parent

Gets the parent collection object.

public System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerOptionService.DesignerOptionCollection Parent { get; }
Value

The parent collection object, or null if there is no parent.

Properties

Gets the collection of properties offered by this DesignerOptionService.DesignerOptionCollection, along with all of its children.

public System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptorCollection Properties { get; }
Value
PropertyDescriptorCollection

The collection of properties offered by this DesignerOptionService.DesignerOptionCollection, along with all of its children.

Remarks

PropertyDescriptor objects are taken directly from the value passed to the CreateOptionCollection method and are wrapped in an additional property descriptor that hides the value object from the user. This means that any value may be passed into the component parameter of the various PropertyDescriptor methods. The value is not recognized and is replaced with the correct value internally.

Methods

CopyTo(Array,Int32)

Copies the entire collection to a compatible one-dimensional Array, starting at the specified index of the target array.

public void CopyTo (Array array, int index);
array
Array

The one-dimensional Array that is the destination of the elements copied from the collection. The array must have zero-based indexing.

index
Int32

The zero-based index in array at which copying begins.

GetEnumerator()

Returns an IEnumerator that can be used to iterate this collection.

public System.Collections.IEnumerator GetEnumerator ();
Returns
IEnumerator

An IEnumerator that can be used to iterate this collection.

IndexOf(DesignerOptionService+DesignerOptionCollection)

Returns the index of the first occurrence of a given value in a range of this collection.

public int IndexOf (System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerOptionService.DesignerOptionCollection value);
value

The object to locate in the collection.

Returns
Int32

The index of the first occurrence of value within the entire collection, if found; otherwise, the lower bound of the collection minus 1.

Remarks

The collection is searched, in one direction, from beginning to end.

ShowDialog()

Displays a dialog box user interface (UI) with which the user can configure the options in this DesignerOptionService.DesignerOptionCollection.

public bool ShowDialog ();
Returns
Boolean

true if the dialog box can be displayed; otherwise, false.

Explicit Interface Implementations

Gets a value indicating whether access to the collection is synchronized and, therefore, thread safe.

bool System.Collections.ICollection.IsSynchronized { get; }
Returns
Boolean

true if the access to the collection is synchronized; otherwise, false.

ICollection.SyncRoot

Gets an object that can be used to synchronize access to the collection.

object System.Collections.ICollection.SyncRoot { get; }
Returns
System.Object

An object that can be used to synchronize access to the collection.

Adds an item to the IList.

value

Int32

The position into which the new element was inserted.

Removes all items from the collection.

value

The Object to locate in the collection

Boolean

true if the Object is found in the collection; otherwise, false.

IList.IndexOf(Object)

Determines the index of a specific item in the collection.

The Object to locate in the collection.

Returns
Int32

The index of value if found in the list; otherwise, -1.

Gets a value indicating whether the collection has a fixed size.

Returns
Boolean

IList.IsReadOnly

Gets a value indicating whether the collection is read-only.

Returns
Boolean

Int32

Removes the collection item at the specified index.

index
Int32
